name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_DISABLE_ALL
description: Global assert disable

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_ADC
description: Enable/disable assertions in the ADC module

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_ADDRESS_ALIAS
description: Enable/disable assertions in memory address aliasing macros

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_CLOCKS
description: Enable/disable assertions in the clocks module

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_DMA
description: Enable/disable DMA assertions

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_EXCEPTION
description: Enable/disable assertions in the exception module

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_FLASH
description: Enable/disable assertions in the flash module

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_GPIO
description: Enable/disable assertions in the GPIO module

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_I2C
description: Enable/disable assertions in the I2C module

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_INTERP
description: Enable/disable assertions in the interpolation module

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_IRQ
description: Enable/disable assertions in the IRQ module

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_LOCK_CORE
description: Enable/disable assertions in the lock core

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_PHEAP
description: Enable/disable assertions in the pheap module

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_PIO
description: Enable/disable assertions in the PIO module

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_PIO_INSTRUCTIONS
description: Enable/disable assertions in the PIO instructions

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_PWM
description: Enable/disable assertions in the PWM module

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_SPI
description: Enable/disable assertions in the SPI module

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_SYNC
description: Enable/disable assertions in the HW sync module

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_TIME
description: Enable/disable assertions in the time module

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_TIMER
description: Enable/disable assertions in the timer module

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLED_UART
description: Enable/disable assertions in the UART module

name: PARAM_ASSERTIONS_ENABLE_ALL
description: Global assert enable

name: PICO_BOOTSEL_VIA_DOUBLE_RESET_ACTIVITY_LED
description: Optionally define a pin to use as bootloader activity LED when BOOTSEL mode is entered via reset double tap

name: PICO_BOOTSEL_VIA_DOUBLE_RESET_INTERFACE_DISABLE_MASK
description: Optionally disable either the mass storage interface (bit 0) or the PICOBOOT interface (bit 1) when entering BOOTSEL mode via double reset

name: PICO_BOOTSEL_VIA_DOUBLE_RESET_TIMEOUT_MS
description: Window of opportunity for a second press of a reset button to enter BOOTSEL mode (milliseconds)

name: PICO_BOOT_STAGE2_CHOOSE_AT25SF128A
description: Select boot2_at25sf128a as the boot stage 2 when no boot stage 2 selection is made by the CMake build

name: PICO_BOOT_STAGE2_CHOOSE_GENERIC_03H
description: Select boot2_generic_03h as the boot stage 2 when no boot stage 2 selection is made by the CMake build

name: PICO_BOOT_STAGE2_CHOOSE_IS25LP080
description: Select boot2_is25lp080 as the boot stage 2 when no boot stage 2 selection is made by the CMake build

name: PICO_BOOT_STAGE2_CHOOSE_W25Q080
description: Select boot2_w25q080 as the boot stage 2 when no boot stage 2 selection is made by the CMake build

name: PICO_BOOT_STAGE2_CHOOSE_W25X10CL
description: Select boot2_w25x10cl as the boot stage 2 when no boot stage 2 selection is made by the CMake build

name: PICO_BUILD_BOOT_STAGE2_NAME
description: The name of the boot stage 2 if selected by the build

name: PICO_CMSIS_RENAME_EXCEPTIONS
description: Whether to rename SDK exceptions such as isr_nmi to their CMSIS equivalent i.e. NMI_Handler

name: PICO_CORE1_STACK_SIZE
description: Stack size for core 1

name: PICO_DEBUG_MALLOC
description: Enable/disable debug printf from malloc

name: PICO_DEBUG_MALLOC_LOW_WATER
description: Define the lower bound for allocation addresses to be printed by PICO_DEBUG_MALLOC

name: PICO_DEBUG_PIN_BASE
description: First pin to use for debug output (if enabled)

name: PICO_DEBUG_PIN_COUNT
description: Number of pins to use for debug output (if enabled)

name: PICO_DEFAULT_I2C
description: Define the default I2C for a board

name: PICO_DEFAULT_I2C_SCL_PIN
description: Define the default I2C SCL pin

name: PICO_DEFAULT_I2C_SDA_PIN
description: Define the default I2C SDA pin

name: PICO_DEFAULT_IRQ_PRIORITY
description: Define the default IRQ priority

name: PICO_DEFAULT_LED_PIN
description: Optionally define a pin that drives a regular LED on the board

name: PICO_DEFAULT_LED_PIN_INVERTED
description: 1 if LED is inverted or 0 if not

name: PICO_DEFAULT_SPI
description: Define the default SPI for a board

name: PICO_DEFAULT_SPI_CSN_PIN
description: Define the default SPI CSN pin

name: PICO_DEFAULT_SPI_RX_PIN
description: Define the default SPI RX pin

name: PICO_DEFAULT_SPI_SCK_PIN
description: Define the default SPI SCK pin

name: PICO_DEFAULT_SPI_TX_PIN
description: Define the default SPI TX pin

name: PICO_DEFAULT_UART
description: Define the default UART used for printf etc

name: PICO_DEFAULT_UART_BAUD_RATE
description: Define the default UART baudrate

name: PICO_DEFAULT_UART_RX_PIN
description: Define the default UART RX pin

name: PICO_DEFAULT_UART_TX_PIN
description: Define the default UART TX pin

name: PICO_DEFAULT_WS2812_PIN
description: Optionally define a pin that controls data to a WS2812 compatible LED on the board

name: PICO_DEFAULT_WS2812_POWER_PIN
description: Optionally define a pin that controls power to a WS2812 compatible LED on the board

name: PICO_DISABLE_SHARED_IRQ_HANDLERS
description: Disable shared IRQ handlers

name: PICO_DOUBLE_SUPPORT_ROM_V1
description: Include double support code for RP2040 B0 when that chip revision is supported

name: PICO_FLASH_SIZE_BYTES
description: size of primary flash in bytes

name: PICO_FLOAT_SUPPORT_ROM_V1
description: Include float support code for RP2040 B0 when that chip revision is supported

name: PICO_HEAP_SIZE
description: Heap size to reserve

name: PICO_MALLOC_PANIC
description: Enable/disable panic when an allocation failure occurs

name: PICO_MAX_SHARED_IRQ_HANDLERS
description: Maximum number of shared IRQ handlers

name: PICO_NO_FPGA_CHECK
description: Remove the FPGA platform check for small code size reduction

name: PICO_NO_RAM_VECTOR_TABLE
description: Enable/disable the RAM vector table

name: PICO_PANIC_FUNCTION
description: Name of a function to use in place of the stock panic function or empty string to simply breakpoint on panic

name: PICO_PHEAP_MAX_ENTRIES
description: Maximum number of entries in the pheap

name: PICO_PRINTF_ALWAYS_INCLUDED
description: Whether to always include printf code even if only called weakly (by panic)

name: PICO_PRINTF_DEFAULT_FLOAT_PRECISION
description: Define default floating point precision

name: PICO_PRINTF_FTOA_BUFFER_SIZE
description: Define printf ftoa buffer size

name: PICO_PRINTF_MAX_FLOAT
description: Define the largest float suitable to print with %f

name: PICO_PRINTF_NTOA_BUFFER_SIZE
description: Define printf ntoa buffer size

name: PICO_PRINTF_SUPPORT_EXPONENTIAL
description: Enable exponential floating point printing

name: PICO_PRINTF_SUPPORT_FLOAT
description: Enable floating point printing

name: PICO_PRINTF_SUPPORT_LONG_LONG
description: Enable support for long long types (%llu or %p)

name: PICO_PRINTF_SUPPORT_PTRDIFF_T
description: Enable support for the ptrdiff_t type (%t)

name: PICO_QUEUE_MAX_LEVEL
description: Maintain a field for the highest level that has been reached by a queue

name: PICO_RP2040_B0_SUPPORTED
description: Whether to include any specific software support for RP2040 B0 revision

name: PICO_RP2040_B1_SUPPORTED
description: Whether to include any specific software support for RP2040 B1 revision

name: PICO_RP2040_B2_SUPPORTED
description: Whether to include any specific software support for RP2040 B2 revision

name: PICO_SHARED_IRQ_HANDLER_DEFAULT_ORDER_PRIORITY
description: Set default shared IRQ order priority

name: PICO_SPINLOCK_ID_CLAIM_FREE_FIRST
description: Lowest Spinlock ID in the 'claim free' range

name: PICO_SPINLOCK_ID_CLAIM_FREE_LAST
description: Highest Spinlock ID in the 'claim free' range

name: PICO_SPINLOCK_ID_HARDWARE_CLAIM
description: Spinlock ID for Hardware claim protection

name: PICO_SPINLOCK_ID_IRQ
description: Spinlock ID for IRQ protection

name: PICO_SPINLOCK_ID_OS1
description: First Spinlock ID reserved for use by low level OS style software

name: PICO_SPINLOCK_ID_OS2
description: Second Spinlock ID reserved for use by low level OS style software

name: PICO_SPINLOCK_ID_STRIPED_FIRST
description: Lowest Spinlock ID in the 'striped' range

name: PICO_SPINLOCK_ID_STRIPED_LAST
description: Highest Spinlock ID in the 'striped' range

name: PICO_SPINLOCK_ID_TIMER
description: Spinlock ID for Timer protection

name: PICO_STACK_SIZE
description: Stack Size

name: PICO_STDIO_DEFAULT_CRLF
description: Default for CR/LF conversion enabled on all stdio outputs

name: PICO_STDIO_ENABLE_CRLF_SUPPORT
description: Enable/disable CR/LF output conversion support

name: PICO_STDIO_SEMIHOSTING_DEFAULT_CRLF
description: Default state of CR/LF translation for semihosting output

name: PICO_STDIO_STACK_BUFFER_SIZE
description: Define printf buffer size (on stack)... this is just a working buffer not a max output size

name: PICO_STDIO_UART_DEFAULT_CRLF
description: Default state of CR/LF translation for UART output

name: PICO_STDIO_USB_CONNECT_WAIT_TIMEOUT_MS
description: Maximum number of milliseconds to wait during initialization for a CDC connection from the host (negative means indefinite) during initialization

name: PICO_STDIO_USB_DEFAULT_CRLF
description: Default state of CR/LF translation for USB output

name: PICO_STDIO_USB_ENABLE_RESET_VIA_BAUD_RATE
description: Enable/disable resetting into BOOTSEL mode if the host sets the baud rate to a magic value (PICO_STDIO_USB_RESET_MAGIC_BAUD_RATE)

name: PICO_STDIO_USB_ENABLE_RESET_VIA_VENDOR_INTERFACE
description: Enable/disable resetting into BOOTSEL mode via an additional VENDOR USB interface - enables picotool based reset

name: PICO_STDIO_USB_LOW_PRIORITY_IRQ
description: low priority (non hardware) IRQ number to claim for tud_task() background execution

name: PICO_STDIO_USB_POST_CONNECT_WAIT_DELAY_MS
description: Number of extra milliseconds to wait when using PICO_STDIO_USB_CONNECT_WAIT_TIMEOUT_MS after a host CDC connection is detected (some host terminals seem to sometimes lose transmissions sent right after connection)

name: PICO_STDIO_USB_RESET_BOOTSEL_ACTIVITY_LED
description: Optionally define a pin to use as bootloader activity LED when BOOTSEL mode is entered via USB (either VIA_BAUD_RATE or VIA_VENDOR_INTERFACE)

name: PICO_STDIO_USB_RESET_BOOTSEL_FIXED_ACTIVITY_LED
description: Whether the pin specified by PICO_STDIO_USB_RESET_BOOTSEL_ACTIVITY_LED is fixed or can be modified by picotool over the VENDOR USB interface

name: PICO_STDIO_USB_RESET_BOOTSEL_INTERFACE_DISABLE_MASK
description: Optionally disable either the mass storage interface (bit 0) or the PICOBOOT interface (bit 1) when entering BOOTSEL mode via USB (either VIA_BAUD_RATE or VIA_VENDOR_INTERFACE)

name: PICO_STDIO_USB_RESET_INTERFACE_SUPPORT_RESET_TO_BOOTSEL
description: If vendor reset interface is included allow rebooting to BOOTSEL mode

name: PICO_STDIO_USB_RESET_INTERFACE_SUPPORT_RESET_TO_FLASH_BOOT
description: If vendor reset interface is included allow rebooting with regular flash boot

name: PICO_STDIO_USB_RESET_MAGIC_BAUD_RATE
description: baud rate that if selected causes a reset into BOOTSEL mode (if PICO_STDIO_USB_ENABLE_RESET_VIA_BAUD_RATE is set)

name: PICO_STDIO_USB_RESET_RESET_TO_FLASH_DELAY_MS
description: delays in ms before rebooting via regular flash boot

name: PICO_STDIO_USB_STDOUT_TIMEOUT_US
description: Number of microseconds to be blocked trying to write USB output before assuming the host has disappeared and discarding data

name: PICO_STDIO_USB_TASK_INTERVAL_US
description: Period of microseconds between calling tud_task in the background

name: PICO_STDOUT_MUTEX
description: Enable/disable mutex around stdout

name: PICO_TIME_DEFAULT_ALARM_POOL_DISABLED
description: Disable the default alarm pool

name: PICO_TIME_DEFAULT_ALARM_POOL_HARDWARE_ALARM_NUM
description: Select which HW alarm is used for the default alarm pool

name: PICO_TIME_DEFAULT_ALARM_POOL_MAX_TIMERS
description: Selects the maximum number of concurrent timers in the default alarm pool

name: PICO_TIME_SLEEP_OVERHEAD_ADJUST_US
description: How many microseconds to wake up early (and then busy_wait) to account for timer overhead when sleeping in low power mode

name: PICO_UART_DEFAULT_CRLF
description: Enable/disable CR/LF translation on UART

name: PICO_UART_ENABLE_CRLF_SUPPORT
description: Enable/disable CR/LF translation support

name: PICO_USE_MALLOC_MUTEX
description: Whether to protect malloc etc with a mutex

name: PICO_XOSC_STARTUP_DELAY_MULTIPLIER
description: Multiplier to lengthen xosc startup delay to accommodate slow-starting oscillators

name: USB_DPRAM_MAX
description: Set amount of USB RAM used by USB system

name: XOSC_MHZ
description: The crystal oscillator frequency in Mhz
